comments.value:
This is a rather late request for an amendment to the Young Leaders pages which is actually required rather soon. I'm really hoping this doesn't turn out to be too complex, as we need the pages to be editable within a couple of weeks.... My bad, as I have sat on these templates rather too long with being away and everything else I have been juggling.

It is basically a change to the section 'Meet the Young Leaders' http://www.london2012.com/young-leaders/meet to make it function more like a blog. 

So there will be 2 new templates:

1. Revised 'Meet the Young Leaders':  http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/

This page is the generic Young Leaders updates page that shows the latest Young Leaders news and is not specific to any one particular Young Leaders team. Users would get to this page by clicking the Meet the Young Leaders link in the main navigation.

2. Revised team page: http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/index2.html

This is a team specific page (one template that can be used to create individual pages for each team)

 
If you ignore the content and focus on the page templates you can see that they are different. The differences are:
- The generic news template has links to all individual teams in the top section of the page
- The team specific template has links to individual Young Leader pages in the top section of the page, and a link to go back to view all the teams

I have asked PJ at Collective to send through the html to you today - can we have a chat about it when you get it so we can get a sense of how long it will take to implement?

Thanks - and apologies for adding to your already-overflowing plate...

Morag
Marking as high.
Anyone has a zip file in there inbox they don't know what to do with?
Hello - is it possible to let me know your thoughts on this - and if you have any questions? Does end of next week for template handover look feasible? Thanks!
We are aiming to get this done by the end of this week. We are unlikely to be ready to handover before Friday. Estimated time: up to 2 days.

Hi Danny

Can we do our best for end of Friday on this? Internal client needs to be able to input content next week.

Thank you
its real tricky, everything has used the blog template and put a blog class on the body whereas it should be 'meet' for the main nav selection, tricky, i will try to hack it

CMS interface added under the Blogs tab at http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/Young%20leaders%20blog%20posts

We have added the ability to add videos to blogs. It works in the same way as video links on existing blog pages.

The new Young Leaders pages are still being tidied up and readied for publication. We don't recommend publishing anything for now. If in doubt, please ask.

We do still need to take a bit of time out to get the new pages looking right on staging. I have just (re-)published the new stylesheets now that the /css folder is not being synched to live. This will need a bit of attention (hopefully not much) on Monday.

I have agreed with Morag that the image carousel in the original blog designs are a bit of a stretch.

We are keeping this to 2 days, which is about right in terms of Lars' time.

Lars, I have just had a look at Young Leaders on staging:
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/young-leaders/
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/young-leaders/meet/
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/young-leaders/blog/

It looks like the new CSS file has been published to staging, but not to live (which is correct):
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/css/young-leaders.css
http://www.london2012.com/css/young-leaders.css

It doesn't look to me like all the required CSS is being picked up. Could you take a look, because I am very keen for LOCOG to look at this on staging and then for us to publish to live if they are happy with it, so we can close this ticket.
Erm someone must have deleted the young-leaders-new.css so i changed the master template to the old style sheet which i hope is the new style sheet. Gonna republish
fix0red

The new pages are on http://locksley.london2012.com/young-leaders/ (or http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/young-leaders/). None of the young leaders section is currently being published to live.

Thank you!

Can you advise - are these templates adapted to take the new video player?
No, but converting them is on our to-do list. See #3218.
Do you have a sense which day this will be done
I am marking this one as solved, although we still have #3367 open.

Feb 1 is looking unlikely. We are planning to send a test feed over to e-Dialog this week, but it will be very surprising if the switchover can be concluded in January.

That’s fine – we are now expecting this to take longer than originally planned.

Aiming for 1 March now

Update: We have sent a large subset of the user database (via the secure feed mechanism) and are awaiting feedback from e-Dialog.

Assuming there are no major issues, we should be able to switch to a daily feed as soon as we hear back from e-Dialog.
J: So far I have spent ~8 days on this

So far we have spent :

- Jamie: ~1 day communication / investigation / calls etc. 
- Kieran: 3 days development of PGP/GPG extension layer so we can encrypt the feeds
- Jamie: ~5 days development of new feed / technical liaison / changes
- plus any time we spend from here onwards on it on testing / switch over etc etc etc.

<said previously when it was 6 days>In addition I expect we'll spend another 2 to 3 days making changes to the feed and liaising with eDialog post us sending them our initial test feed and also checking everything is OK once we switch to the live feed, factored into that is time for communication /  testing that everything is matching up. But if things get complex (*) or ITS need our time for further tests or a more complex deployment testing or migration process then that would need additional time</said previously>

Here's my assessment. Jamie, you might want to double-check & add/amend if necessary.

1. (TwoFour) supply the "player".
2. (TwoFour) import all of the existing videos from the site, create thumbs, titles, etc.

3. (LOCOG) Manual task: Edit all existing video pages (166 of them). For each one, you need to find the programmeId from TwoFour, and paste it into the Video page's metadata. This step, although it might seem cumbersome, means that we won't have any duplicates / omissions, and the switchover should then be silent/seamless.
So long as TwoFour are serving the video correctly, these pages can be launched on an ad-hoc basis.

4. (TwoFour) switch on the "notifier". This will "ping" the cms, telling it about each new/updated/deleted video. On the first run, it will notify the CMS of all current videos. This is a slightly redundant step but it will help with testing.
Moving forward, whenever a video is created/updated/deleted in TwoFour, the CMS will be notified, and a Video page will be created/updated/(published)/delated.

5. (LOCOG) Moving forward, Blog & News articles can link to a video by linking to it (from the metadata pane).


(5.) is the only thing that we're not ready to do. If there's a requirement to facilitate videos in blogs/news urgently, then we can do it manually via rhino or some other interim method. Jamie, see my list, below.

Will need to look at rewriting urls at publication time (ie. pages have to have hrefs with contain the short form) and in reverse we need to display the page (via a InteralRedirect) when it is requested via the short url.

There a a couple of approaches I can think of, but this is not a Redirect issue (per sea), it's about making the website appear to have a different URL structure that it does in the CMS.

A possible (although to be approach with caution as it may be very limiting) is to actually change the site structure in the CMS. Although I prefer the approach of allowing some pages to have a 'publication path' which is the path that gets used in links/hrefs published out of the CMS and also in the opposite direction allows us to create a mapping back to the real location of the file (in the CMS or on the file system); this approach allows us to create a /schedule page now and have all links on the site use  /schedule but for the page to actually live somewhere other than the top level of the site for the moment.

From: Liz Goulding
Sent: 30 March 2011 10:39
To: Caroline Hadfield; Roli Barker
Subject: Email update

Hi both,

Here's the scoop:

1.       Budget:  They think it ought to be less than 2 days (£1400), but given that we often ask for lots of tweaks/changes, they are uncomfortable committing to less than that.  So what I propose is a two day cap on the work, but they will actually charge us by the hour ... which could work out to being less than 1 day.  That is how the New Media team work with them on a retainer, so they are very much trustworthy (and I'll watch them).  So if you can ringfence the £1400 for the next week until they complete work, and then raise a PO for the actual amount, hopefully everyone will be happy.

2.       Format: One way of keeping the budget down (it will be much easier for them) is a type of email where the logo comes in embedded as a 'linked image'.  To most users connected to the internet, the email will appear just as you've requested.  The only exception is that if someone downloads all their emails, then turns off their internet connection and tries to look at it, the image won't be there.  It's pretty unusual for people to do that - most people stay connected to the internet when reading their emails - but it is technically possible.  If you are ok with that, then I think we're much more likely to keep it to a day's work.

Let me know if you're happy and I'll get them started!

Liz

P.S.  They're working on the export and 2010 events - it should be fixed today/tomorrow.
